course_description: BUS 110 is a 2-credit hour class that is designed to engage freshman, sophomore, junior and senior Goizueta Scholars each fall. The course changes topics each year, and is designed to creatively integrate business concepts and ideas into specific problem-solving activities. Students work in small groups on a project throughout the semester, in addition to reading and discussing a new book each term. Topics have ranged from housing shortages to block-chain and digital currency.
prerequisites: This section is reserved for students in the BBA program.
sections: Class Nbr: 6153, Section #: 1101, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: F 1-2:15p, Instructor: A. Burdette, Status: Open
